WRITING.TEXT: Thank you for this. It is extremely well explained and put together.

I don't have b/p as an Ed symptom, but it's the exercise that makes me feel out of control. When I would go out in horrible weather at crazy times and just be too afraid to have a day where I didn't work out.
You and your girlfriend are amazing people. I hope you have a fantastically happy and joyful life together.
I no longer run 12 miles a day and I eat dessert almost everyday for the past 2 weeks (my meal plan requires it but follow through is another matter :P).

This happens to me too. Both with language and learning new skills/ hobbies in general. I have to work really hard and make a conscious effort to lean new things in a healthy manner that doesn't interfere with my life.

Target is my go to. But you can search on their website too. Most higher end local chain type places tend to carry it too. Byerleys, for example. Some HyVee's too. (Not sure if those places mean anything to you haha)
Thanks for linking to that DBT subreddit. DBT is changing my life and I'm super excited to discover another relevant resource!
This stuff is amazing. I highly recommend the red velvet flavor as well as the chocolate mint.
If you're trying to get a bus for thanksgiving this close to the holiday, good luck. In my experience, they sell out pretty quick.

I really think you should tell your mom. She probably already can tell if she's an attentive parent. She just may not have felt comfortable saying something because she didn't know how you would react. My therapist told me that the best gift a kid can give their parent is to let them help them. I get where you're coming from though. I too live with my parents and it was really hard to ask for help. Good luck, friend!
Yeah, I lost mine at the same point. My bmi is back up into normal a little bit now. But apparently not quite enough yet. Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: When did your period return during weight restoration?
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry to be so blunt, but I'm just wondering at what bmi/ how far into recovery did you get your period back?

Two events for me really but they both happened the same day. I got up before classes at 5 am to go for my run. It was pouring rain and just above freezing. I had worn out shoes and was so sore and started crying partway through because I wanted to stop but was too scared to. Later that day, I went to Walgreens to buy a snack and stood in the snack aisle for literally 20mins analyzing all of the nutrition content of all the foods and googling about the fruit and suck. I was starving but could not make myself buy anything. So I walked out in tears.
Mine for sure are. I am comorbid with anorexia so that might be part of it, but my obsessions and compulsions are much worse when I am underweight.
Oh my god the scales thing. I thought I was alone.
Please feel free to message me if you need to talk more. :). Good luck, friend.

Cajun spiced deep fried peanuts. They are only sold in the south/ on the internet but they are amazing. You eat then shells and all.
I'm also a bit of a spice whore. Wherever I travel, I have to stop in shops that sell unique or local spices and stock up.
Adding to this, you can email the professor too since they can often manipulate the class list and let people in. Worth a shot anyway.

Hey there. I think it might be a good idea for you to set up an appointment with your doctor. He or she can test you to make sure there is nothing physically wrong with you and then get you a referral to a therapist. If you think there is something wrong, there probably is, and I urge you to get help before it gets worse or out of control. Good luck!
This looks amazing and simple. Thank you so much; I'm gonna try it out this week!
This was me. Like literally the exact same progression. Get her help even if she doesn't think she needs it. Shit can go from stable to life threatening really quickly.
Tomato sauce. I just cannot be bothered.

Chicken feta burgers. Get ground chicken or turkey. Mix in cheese and spices (I recommend a Greek blend) and freeze the patties. When you want to cook them, slap them on the grill. Serve with tatziki sauce, lemon juices, and a nice pretzel bun.
This. If your body is growing lanugo, something is very wrong. Please check in with a doctor and/ or therapist.
The medical concerns can appear out of no where too. Even if she looks totally fine and healthy enough on the outside.
Oh man, I get that emergency mode. I had a week between my intake appointment and when I was admitted and it was hell.

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone tried buspar for OCD?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm newly diagnosed and new to the world of psychiatric meds. My doc started me in this, and it makes me feel weirdly high/ drunk and gives me bad insomnia. Has anyone had success with it? I'm wondering if I should keep trying it or make an appointment to get something else.
I love his style. I just finished Cat'a Cradle.
I'd recommend taking it through your major. I'm pretty sure almost every major has one class that counts as comm b.
I her you on the scared of getting the job you want. For me, anyway, it's all about fear of failure. I'm afraid I'll fail at what I've worked so hard for and what I want.

You need to tell someone. Maybe she'll be mad in the short term, but honestly, she will on some level feel a sense of relief. ED is an illusion of control but really you just feel out of control. You could maybe even give an anonymous tip to her parent or (depending on your age) a school councilor or her doctor. Just an email explaining the situation and maybe ask to stay anonymous.

Repost of my experience from another thread (except for last paragraph): It's honestly not as bad as I had thought it would be. I was diagnosed back in April and started OP. That worked really well for a few months, but then for some issues with OCD, I freaked out and lost a lot of weight really quickly. Coupled with heart rate and liver concerns, I was admitted yesterday to stay for a week or so to get stabilized.
In some ways it's a relief because your meals are picked and plated and you are told to eat then. It helps with regular eating. There is a lot of monitoring and rules which is weird at first being an adult (especially going to the bathroom with the door open) but the forced accountability can help break habits and develop new strategies. The staff is great and able to help 24/7. Where I am, we get schedules every mornin with groups and private appointments to attend. Downtime is expected to be spent in a sitting room with other patients and a nurse so they make sure you aren't exercising in your room.
Speaking of the other patients, there is a whole gamut of people here. There is a wing for teens here and they are kept mostly separate. The adult wing is mostly people in their 20's but several in their 40's and some who have retired and such. A whole range of disordered behaviors too. It's honestly pretty interesting to see how the same/ similar disorders can manifest the same but different in different people. If that makes sense. It's also kind of nice to be surrounded by a community of people who actually understand this crazy disorder.
I've since been discharged and inpatient was really helpful honestly. It's hard to be restricted but it interrupted symptoms and restarted my restoration process and in in the best place I have been in a very long time. I also made some damn good friends through the experience. Kind, compassionate, and understanding despite their own hardships and struggled. I still have a ways to go but I feel so hopeful again. Feel free to PM me if you have more questions or need to talk.

It definitely depends on what you want to major in/ what you want to do with the major. Med schools often prefer the two course sequence. As do many grad schools. At the end of the day, though, it doesn't matter too much. I will say that I have heard that the two course sequence is much more in depth and much more work than 501 (which is what I took). So if you are on the fence about it, I might recommend 501. But again, this really depends on your major as well as your academic strengths.

WRITING.TITLE: I ordered some mother fucking cheese curds today.
WRITING.TEXT:
And I ate every single one of them and they were amazing.
Less than two weeks ago, I had to be hospitalized for medical stabilization. It's a small victory and I still have a long way to go but goddamn does it feel good.

Just wanted to let you know that you aren't alone. I struggle with all of this too. Have you met with a therapist or psychiatrist? I recently had an OCD diagnosis added to my anorexia and it helps a lot with understanding the hatred of the food choosing process. It's still going to be a process for me to learn how to handle this and recover, but it sure helps to know exactly what you're fighting.
Thanks for the thorough response. It was super helpful!! :)
Awesome, thanks!

WRITING.TEXT: Asking for my sister, but is it possible for me to major in genetics (CALS) and psychology (L S)? I'm just not sure how majoring in two different schools works.
Anecdotal here too, but my guns ache like no other. Like it feels like I need to floss because my gums are swollen kind of soreness. Refeeding is weird.
That's the plan I'm on too. I think it really is gonna help in that I have something concrete to follow. I've heard the hunger signals do return eventually.

It's stereotypical for Madison, of course, but I really love Greenbush Bakery.
I'm so so happy to hear this! You are so strong and inspiring; keep fighting the good fight.

WRITING.TITLE: Quick! Is this dress okay to wear to a wedding with a black, short sleeved sweater top?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
I second this vote! The kik group is wonderful.
I don't have an answer for you, but just had to give you a shout out because I too was considering going to the Madison one!
This is the best thing I have read in a very long time. Thank you so much for sharing these reflections!

I'm sorry to hear that you're having such a tough time! Have you tried telling your parents/ a teacher/ councilor what has been going on? It's really hard and really scary but asking for help is the best possible thing you can do for yourself right now. Anorexia has one of the highest death rates of any mental illness and not just because of the starvation aspect- it makes many contemplate suicide. That being said, you are defiantly not alone in that regards. I'm struggling with anorexia right now too and even with parental and therapy, trying to gain back weight to be healthy is really difficult. I would be lying if I said that I haven't wished myself dead more than a few times during this process.
What helps me with those feelings though is having the support of my parents. They don't truly understand the eating disorder because you can't truly understand it until you experience it, but they have read up on the subject such that they can encourage me in my recovery process and provide distractions from my feelings when I'm really low.
My therapist has also been a huge factor in me working on recovery. My parents don't me in touch with her, and I honestly believe that I would be dead right now if I weren't seeing her on a regular basis. It really helps me put the voices in perspective and to try to control them. I'm not trying to scare you, but I really really think it's important that you reach out to a close adult in your life that you can trust. You deserve to be happy and healthy and to live a full life.

Hey there, I have some weird things with utensils too. I have these small plastic spoons that my parents brought home from a froyo place once that I only use for dairy products. And the dairy products taste so much better when eaten that way. Without them, I'm more likely to choose nothing at all than eating something. I prefer plastic utensils in general but they're only a strict requirement for soup and dairy products. I also like to eat all my meals from bowls if at all possible.
The partitioned plate thing you mentioned is really interesting. I have an issue with my foods touching and might have to experiment with that to see if it could help me.
Ugh, yes. The fact that losing weight and calories and food are more important to me than life and happiness and literally everything else kills me. Good luck with everything!

The gyms are all at their busiest in the mornings (around 8-9) and in the evenings 5-10) or so. The best is if you have a break during the day where you can go (late morning or early afternoon). If you can get there right when it opens, you're good too. On the weekends, it's busy except for the morning.
All this being said, the least busy place is the shell followed by the nat. The serf will always be the busiest. Finally, this time of year is one of the busiest. Many people come to school with aspirations of visiting the gym regularly, but as the semester goes on, many stop going as classes get busier.
Good luck!

Oh man, I feel like I could have just as easily written this post myself. You are certainly not alone in this feeling. I feel like my eating is constantly being watched and I'm being judged for eating huge amounts. I had to move back in with my parents because I just couldn't handle it on my own. Comments like those made by your friends trigger me too even though I know they are not malicious. My friends and even some of my family members have unwittingly said this. Or commented on my food intake. As hard as it is, it might not be a bad idea to take a semester off and move home until you are more healthy. You don't want to be chronically underweight and recovery is really really hard. I'm being supported by my parents 100% and I'm still struggling like that. Feel free to PM me if you ever need to talk with or vent to someone who gets it. Good luck!
I really like this idea.
